original:
A drug scaffold is typically an analog of a drug whose mechanism of action is under investigation. Importantly, it binds to its target reversibly, which more accurately reflects the interaction between most drugs and their targets. 

There are various types of photoreactive groups used in drug scaffolds. These differ fundamentally from activity-based protein profiling (ABPP) probes. While ABPP specifically labels nucleophilic amino acid
sampled:
A drug scaffold is typically an analog with a drug whose mechanism about role is under investigation. Importantly, it binds to its target reversibly, which more accurately reflects the interaction between most drugs plus their targets. 

There are various types of photoreactive groups used in drug scaffolds. These differ fundamentally from activity-based protein profiling (ABPP) probes. While ABPP specifically labels nucleophilic amino acid
